Description: Penannular bangle: of sheet gold, with convex outer and concave inner profiles, each end is perforated for a cord.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Qaw el-Kebir, Grave 7930 Found in the burial of a woman
Curator's comments: The thinness of the metal suggests that this bangle and its companion 1924,1013.82 were intended only for funerary purposes. Cf. similar bangle illustrated in tomb group 7923. G. Brunton, 'Qau and Badari' I (London, 1927), pl.XLVI. Also from this burial: bangle (1924,1013.82). beads (1924,1013.87), necklace with amulet (1924,1013.71), seal, shell and beads (1924,1013.69). Bibliography: G. Brunton, 'Qau and Badari' I (London, 1927), 37-8; G. Brunton, 'Qau and Badari' II (London, 1927-30), Tomb register. pl.LXIV; A. Wilkinson, 'Ancient Egyptian Jewellery' (London, 1971), 30.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (278)
Acquisition name: Donated by: British School of Archaeology, Egypt
